alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 1:09AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following counties, Elbert and Hart. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 105 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen thus far in the advisory area, and an additional inch is likely through 4 am EDT. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elberton, Hartwell, Royston, Reed Creek, Bowman, Canon, Bowersville, Russell State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Lake Hartwell, Dewy Rose, Nuberg, Sweet City, Ruckersville, Rock Branch, Vanna and Fortsonia. Flooding is most likely along and near Beaverdam Creek, Little Beaverdam Creek, and Coldwater Creek near the Hart and Elbert border. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
